name: Griffon Vulture
description: The Griffon Vulture is a large scavenger with a white neck ruff, known for soaring flight.
spread_note: Found in southern Europe, Africa, and parts of Asia.
food_note: Locates carcasses from high altitudes, feeding in groups.
proportions: Wingspan: 2.3-2.8 m, length: 95-110 cm, weight: 6-11 kg.
reproduction: Lays 1 egg in a cliff nest, incubation about 50-60 days.
attractions: Impressive in zoos for their size and scavenging role.
projects_note: Not endangered, but poisoning is a threat.
breeding: Bred in captivity for reintroduction programs.
